alert.note: Alert for Northwest Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 8:37AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM IN NORTHEAST CONNECTICUT... At 836 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Thompson, or 18 miles north of Plainfield, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Minor flooding from torrential rainfall. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Webster and Douglas around 845 AM EDT. Sutton and Millville around 850 AM EDT. Woonsocket, Northbridge, Uxbridge, North Smithfield, Blackstone, Hopedale and Mendon around 855 AM EDT. Franklin, Milford and Bellingham around 900 AM EDT. Ashland, Holliston, Medway, Norfolk, Millis and Sherborn around 905 AM EDT. Walpole, Sharon, Medfield and Dover around 910 AM EDT. Needham, Norwood, Wellesley, Dedham, Canton and Westwood around 915 AM EDT. Randolph and Milton around 920 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
